messages.content:
make it so it prints all the content to the terminal # Find all files that might contain a chat input component
find ./src -type f -name "*.tsx" -o -name "*.jsx" | grep -i "chat\|input" | sort

# Find files that specifically use useState with 'input'
grep -r "const \[input" --include="*.tsx" --include="*.jsx" ./src

# Find components that might be using setInput incorrectly
grep -r "setinput" --include="*.tsx" --include="*.jsx" ./src

# Look for chat panel components
find ./src -type f -name "*.tsx" -o -name "*.jsx" | grep -i "chatpanel\|chatinterface" | sort

Here‚Äôs a revised script that **prints all relevant content to the terminal**, not just the filenames or matched lines. This includes the full contents of each matching file, and it will be formatted for clarity:

```bash
#!/bin/bash

echo "üîç Finding chat/input-related files..."
chat_input_files=$(find ./src -type f \( -name "*.tsx" -o -name "*.jsx" \) | grep -i "chat\|input" | sort)

for file in $chat_input_files; do
  echo -e "\nüìÑ --- File: $file ---"
  cat "$file"
done

echo -e "\nüîç Files using \`useState\` with 'input':"
grep -r "const \[input" --include="*.tsx" --include="*.jsx" ./src | while read -r match; do
  filepath=$(echo "$match" | cut -d: -f1)
  echo -e "\nüìÑ --- File: $filepath (matched useState input) ---"
  cat "$filepath"
done

echo -e "\nüîç Files with possible incorrect \`setInput\` usage:"
grep -ri "setinput" --include="*.tsx" --include="*.jsx" ./src | while read -r match; do
  filepath=$(echo "$match" | cut -d: -f1)
  echo -e "\nüìÑ --- File: $filepath (matched setInput) ---"
  cat "$filepath"
done

echo -e "\nüîç Looking for ChatPanel or ChatInterface components..."
chatpanel_files=$(find ./src -type f \( -name "*.tsx" -o -name "*.jsx" \) | grep -i "chatpanel\|chatinterface" | sort)

for file in $chatpanel_files; do
  echo -e "\nüìÑ --- File: $file ---"
  cat "$file"
done
```

### Notes:
- You can save this script to a file (e.g., `show-chat-code.sh`) and run it with `bash show-chat-code.sh`.
- This assumes files are not too large. If some files are huge, consider adding line limits or syntax highlighting (`bat`, `less`, or `grep --color`).

Let me know if you want the output filtered by specific keywords or context-aware excerpts instead of full files.
